questions.question: ………………….. quick results when you start learning a language.
questions.description: Negative imperatives are made with do not + infinitive without to.

questions.question: You seldom work on Saturdays, ………………….?
questions.description: Clauses with words like seldom, hardly, little, and few have a negative sense. Affirmative question tags are used after them.

questions.question: There is little point in doing anything about it, ……………..?
questions.description: Clauses with words like seldom, hardly, little, and few have a negative sense. Affirmative question tags are used after them.

questions.question: He has few reasons for staying, ……………….?
questions.description: Clauses with words like seldom, hardly, little, and few have a negative sense. Affirmative question tags are used after them.

questions.question: I ...................... the flowers. Just after I finished it started raining.
questions.description: We use the structure ‘needn’t have’ to mean that something was unnecessary.

questions.question: She is …………………. a great dancer than I am.
questions.description: We use ‘no more’ with nouns to talk about quantity or degree.

questions.question: .....................… wished me a happy birthday.
questions.description: No one cannot be followed by of. The other two options are possible here.

questions.question: Mother suggested ………………….. a dentist.
questions.description: Suggest cannot be followed by object + infinitive.

questions.question: I didn’t ask …………….. for the meal.
questions.description: Some verbs are followed by object + infinitive.

questions.question: After putting it off many times, we ………………. managed to have a holiday in France.
questions.description: Finally suggests that we have been waiting a long time for something.

questions.question: We made many different plans for our holiday, but …………………. we went to Malaysia again.
questions.description: We use in the end to suggest that something happens after a lot of problems or uncertainty.

questions.question: A declarative sentence has a full stop …………………
questions.description: At the end means position at the end of something.
